Reviews.Title: Bought this TV instead of a Samsung or Panasonic - glad I did!
Reviews.Author: Anthony Palombo
Reviews.Content: I learned reading reviews about TVs and trying to draw clear conclusions is like trying to find unobtainium. It also seems that in any ratings table, you may see about 5% to 15% of the ratings being 1 and 2 stars no matter what brand or model you are looking at. Then again, 67% of all statistics are made up on the spot.Now here I am add adding one more to the many stories and opinions out there...I paid the $649 price-tag on this TV and saved much $$$ over my initial choice of the Panasonic GT50 (and second choice a comparable new Samsung), and it turned out to be a good move. I already own a 42" Samsung 1080p plasma for a bedroom, and also have a 2007 42" Pioneer 720p plasma (remember those?) that still has a fantastic picture. I have this new LG TV for about a month now and it works flawlessly. I looked into this after coming across reviews of the LG PA6500 model. I used the calibration settings found on reviews here for the PA6500 and they worked well on the PN6500. I also bought the Disney WOW disk and that worked well too. The TV has a decent picture using factory pre-set Standard mode, but it was much improved by using the customizable Expert 1 (which also allows use of the built-in Picture Wizard) or Expert 2 modes. I actually used Expert 1 with PA6500 calibration settings and Expert 2 with Disney WOW created settings - couldn't really tell the difference in picture clarity, but there was a small difference in color.I use the Panasonic DMP BDT220 Bluray player and it streams Netflix at 720p without any problems. It works so well I didn't need to use my Roku Netflix player anymore (now I have one less device cluttering up my TV area).This TV shows Netflix HD at 720p really well. I sit 10ft away and the 50" seems the perfect size TV for me at this distance. Standard definition DVDs are upscaled well and the picture is sharp. Bluray shows a crisp picture. I watch mostly at night in a darkened room, but the TV shows well enough in the daytime with shades drawn closed.Why did I consider this TV over the Samsung, Panasonic, or even a Sony (which I'm told makes Vizio too)?1. Some reviews pointed out the panel lottery that Samsung and Panasonic (and some others) are engaged in. For example, you buy a Samsung and the panel may be made by Sharpe or some unfamiliar-named manufacturer. So reviews on Samsungs/Panasonics/Sonys are supposedly inconsistent because the corresponding panel is not identified. You can search out the other reviews for this info: the various manufacturer panel label codes have been identified. I was convinced enough not to want to chance getting a non-Samsung or non-Panasonic panel when I'm paying for one. Sony is supposed to be a nice set too but I think there is a large premium in the price due to name (like for Samsung and Pansonic too). It was stated LG does not play the panel lottery so all reviews are for the same LG panel - that makes the LG reviews more reliable to me.2. Electronics engineers we've spoken with that are not affiliated with LG mentioned that LG has higher reliability than the other big names. In the store, I was checking out the LGs when the salesperson came over and steered me to the Panasonics saying how great they were, and the Panasonic he was showing me had severe pixel problems, which he stated was a good reason to buy the extended warrantees. How can a problem TV be a selling point for a 'great' TV?? So, I took a leap of faith that maybe the LG was of a more reliable quality.3. I read reviews that my first choice Panasonic GT50 was really difficult to calibrate and that The Geek Squad has only a 50% success rate in dialing it in. I'm not paying hundreds of dollars for a coin-toss chance of having it calibrated properly. The Panasonic Viera TC-P50GT50 shown in Magnolia seemed dull and not that sharp of a picture for the money, and it was a dark room which is where plasma's are supposed to show best. Why go with a reportedly difficult to calibrate TV? And the reviews about Panasonic's burn-in problem? Those are plenty - no thanks.4. If points # 1,2 and 3 above turn out to be bogus, I still have a great-picture and LG's 2 year panel warranty and 1 year parts-n-labor warranty to fall back on. Now that I see the picture quality is really nice, I could chance spending $649/yr for 2 or 3 years on replacement LGs and it would still be cost effective compared to the big name TVs. Do Samsung or Panasonic, or even Sony, really honor their warrantees? I read enough horror story reviews to be convinced they typically don't, or at least don't until after putting the really die-hard persistent 'valued-customers' through much hassle.  And if LG is the same with warrantees, I'd rather be out $650 than $1800 or more. And there are enough bad reviews on Extended Warrantees to make those a gamble as well.So far so good - I have a picture quality that I see is on par with the Samsung/Panasonic for about a third of the price. My Pioneer does show a great picture though, even for a 2007 720p model (used online calibration settings I got from CNET). Overall, the LG picture quality seems to be better than my Samsung plasma (I have a 40" Samsung 120Hz LCD in the basement, but I found I like plasmas the best because they show dark scenes better and also fast motion better).  This is after calibrating both with Disney WOW, and even when using other online calibration settings for both the Samsung and LG the LG seems to show better.Some (many?) reviews complain about the quality of LG and if my TV craps out or the pictures degrades anytime, I'll be back here for a humble update. And I will seek to get the TV fixed under warranty and if not successful I may even buy the same again to see if my luck changes. See, in the end this TV game is all about taking chances anyway, and for me the less costly chances are the better risk.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous, gorgeous picture....puts you right in the movie.
Reviews.Author: T Boyer "seattleparent"
Reviews.Content: Bought it elsewhere because the price was lower than Amazon at the time (though now Amazon's prices have come down too). The professional reviews said this is pretty close to state of the art plasma for a super low price, and I agree. No hitches at all, adjusting picture settings was easy, and the picture is just incredibly gorgeous. Movies look the way they were intended to look -- the color is even more true than the typical movie theater projection system. Motion is handled really well -- no soap opera effect.Here are some decision points to consider:1) If you have a room with good light control, such as a basement den, this TV (plasma with a clear glass screen) is great. If you have an upstairs room with ambient light, this might not be your TV. You probably want LED for more brightness, and a non-glare screen.2) If you want your colors super warm and vivid, then then LED is maybe a better choice. If you want natural, true, accurate color, this TV is about as good as you can find at any price.3) If you want smart TV features or lots of HDMI ports (this model only has two), this is not your model. If you want pretty close to state of the art plasma picture quality for a great price, this is a super choice. We overcame the lack of HDMI ports with an inexpensive HDMI switch.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal Picture
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This LG TV was an upgrade from our 42" HDTV.  It set up within minutes and requires minimal tinkering to begin enjoying your television.  The size upgrade alone was obviously imposing, but the picture is amazing.  Between you and me, I think I prefer this TV to the LED Cinema TV dominating our family room.  This is probably a matter of taste, but the picture on this set is slightly sharper. I simply can't say enough about how real the images appear on anything I've chosen to watch.  I will say, I won't be using the ECO-Friendly display.  It is simply too dark to make viewing enjoyable.  It's a wasted feature on this set where a vivid picture is the major draw.I love the way this TV looks even when it is off.  LG doesn't muddle the aesthetics with casing and framing.  The result is a beautifully streamlined display which is 98% screen. It doesn't come with the bells and whistles of other TVs, WIFI for example.  With only 2 HDMI inputs and 2 gamers in the house, this can be inconvenient.  This may not be a consideration for some. The remote is also pretty standard. The sound is near worthless without the use of additional speakers.  Though the sound is clear and undistorted, it doesn't get loud or make much of an impact without assistance.This TV is obviously designed for someone looking for a superior picture at a decent price point, and if that's you, I can recommend this TV whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: LG Electronics 50PN6500 Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: lil "lil"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by stating that overall I really love this TV. The picture is absolutely stunning. More on that later.There are some minor (at least to me) things that I don't like so I will cover those first. During the initial setup the TV got stuck on trying to search channels on the coax connection even though I had nothing connected to it. It took me awhile to figure out that it was stuck. I had to break out of the setup and go about the menu to finish it. Since it seems to recognize the HDMI connections I would have expected it to know that nothing was connected to the coax input. Oh well. And it would be nice to have more than the 2 HDMI connections but it's not that big of a deal to get a switcher to add more inputs. My final critique is just a general issue with any plasma tv - any light source that is opposite the tv will reflect in the picture. In our case we have a huge picture window that reflects. Obviously you can move the tv elsewhere or like us we just bought some heavy curtains to block the outside light when watching during the day.I love the ease of use of the settings on these tv. You get a nice menu with icons so there is no mistaking what to click on. There is also an input button which allows you to change the input source, however, it also recognizes if you put DVD in your player and will ask you if you want to change to it. Very nice. For picture modes, I have not tried to do anything custom even though you are allowed to do something. I haven't found any need to. The available settings works just fine for me. I generally leave it in "Standard" mode for tv, but my favorite is "Cinema", especially when playing Blu-ray DVD's. As I stated previously, the picture is stunning in all modes. I love the deep, deep blacks and movie action scenes are awesome. As with the picture, the audio settings are easy to use. I quickly made a custom one with the bass enhanced to sound good with my sound bar. I would characterize the internal speakers as adequate but I usually use the external sound bar. I have not tried the USB connector yet but it's at least available if I ever decide to copy a bunch of movies to my external hard drive.I also wanted to comment on the slenderness of this tv. It's very, very slim for a plasma tv. I had not realized that it would be until we unpacked it and set it up. Very pleasing. And my wife loves the fact the housing itself is not very big either.Really, overall this tv shines.

Reviews.Title: MAYBE THE BEST LOW-END TV YOU'LL BUY THIS YEAR!
Reviews.Author: Haze Blackmon "TheInsatiableBookReader"
Reviews.Content: I've had this really awesome plasma tv set up for about 6 hours now and used it, so far, for Blu-Ray(watched Gangster Squad), played an hour of the PS3 game Dead Island: Riptide and have fiddled around with cable(mostly news channels). For a plasma this size and it being 1080p it's a lotta bang for the buck. It took some playing around with the various settings to get picture and sound where I want them. Once I got it where I want the picture is nothing short of amazing, especially Blu-Ray! Even cable looks really good. I don't have high-def cable, it's just standard stuff, but it is really crisp and clear. The sound on this LG model is very good, though some will still want an external sound system. Me, I'm fine with the sound. I cranked up Gangster Squad and it hurt my ears. Of course, this LG is in a 12x15 room, so I don't know how the sound would be in a massive room. I suspect it would still be quite audible.The only drawbacks I've noticed was when I was playing Dead Island: Riptide on my Playstation 3 and the black levels(in general). The framerate of Dead Island dropped quite a bit at times and there was some juddering. However, I don't know whether this was a game issue or the tv. Most low-end plasmas are not the best option to play a video game on. The graphics though looks beautiful on Dead Island. As far as the black levels, this is just me being nit-picky. They are really just average and this is to be expected with cheaper plasmas. I was just hoping this year they would have deeper black levels on these models since LG really increased picture quality this year(actually over the last two years there's been a big increase in pic quality). Yes, some people will bemoan the fact that this isn't a 3D television and that it isn't a Smart TV, but that's really a non-issue for me. I rarely use Smart TV and 3D I use maybe once a month(I have a 47 inch 3D LG I bought in August 2011 for that purpose). The side viewing angles are just like other plasmas - perfect! You won't find that with LCD/LED tv's.The bottom line is if you're in the market for a television and don't have a big budget, then this is defintely one that should be at the top of your list. Price, picture, sound, looks of the tv(it's a beauty), installing the stand, setup of the tv, and plenty of hdmi inputs all make this a serious contender this year in the plasma tv market. I suspect this one will be a hot seller! Again, if you're not into all the fancy features of the high-end models, and Smart TV and 3D aren't a necessity, then you've found yourself a great television. This tv came very well packed in the box, btw.... bravo LG!

Reviews.Title: Amazing plasma tv
Reviews.Author: jubrusion
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about a week and it is amazing. The picture quality is better than my bravia 1080p 120hz 46 inch (which has been moved to the bedroom). I have the lg in the corner of my living room and the side viewing angles on this plasma is as good as in front of the tv (downfall of a lcd/led tv). I would recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Could not believe this TV for this price!
Reviews.Author: PrimeLovingMike
Reviews.Content: FedEx got it to me in one piece.  Picture is awesome.  Sound is best I have seen out of a flat TV.  If you have roku or Apple TV and don't need smart TV, this is the way to go.  The savings on shipping paid for half of my Prime membership...

Reviews.Title: Seeing is Believing - An HD-Obsessed FAQ
Reviews.Author: Tyson
Reviews.Content: The first thing you'll probably notice about this TV is the price. At the time of this review, Amazon is selling it for $649.00 with free shipping. This is very competitively priced for a 50-inch, 1080p television, especially from a major brand like LG. Some other words you might notice are things like "Plasma" and "600 Hz" which I will try to help explain if you're not already familiar. Below is my FAQ and review, if you have any other questions, please post in the comments and I'll try to help out to be the best of my ability.01. How is the picture quality?Fantastic. Depending on which Blu Ray you pop in, you may feel like you're watching a movie in hyper reality. Like you're IN the movie. The characters flow across the screen in such perfect refresh rates that it truly trippy to behold. I don't think it's the absolute BEST image I've ever seen on an 1080p television, but I'm VERY impressed. Not even the snobbiest HD expert can give too harsh of a rating in regards to the picture quality.02. Will I need to fiddle with any of the picture settings or will it look good right out of the box?The default image setting is some kind of "eco-friendly" mode which is slightly darker than usual. Kinda like when you unplug your laptop and the screen dims a bit. So NO, out of the box the image isn't right. The good news is that they include some cool picture presets such as "Game" and "Cinema" which are much better. Right now I keep mine on "Cinema" which is very crisp and just about always looks right. You can also adjust every little individual setting (brightness, contrast, etc) if you desire.03. OK, but I thought 3D and LED TVs were the new rage. Isn't PLASMA outdated?Yes and no. PLASMA used to have issues with images being "burnt" into the screen, but those problems have been fixed. In fact, the evolution of Plasma has come along amazingly well. Some people even argue that it gives the most "natural" look. However, in my opinion, LED is definitely superior in regards to overall picture quality, especially when it comes to black levels. Still, not every LED TV is created equal. I've seen plenty whose picture was much better than this TV. I've also seen some that look much worse. LEDs do tend to last longer and are even thinner than Plasma, but right now I don't think they're necessarily superior by definition. It depends on the TV. 3D is also a format that is not going away, and if you're in to that, the lack-of-3D capability may be a disappointment in regards to this TV.04. What about 4K TVs?Sony will be rolling out its first wave of 4K televisions this year - here's one: Sony XBR-55X900A 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz 3D LED 4K Ultra HDTV - so I don't actually know how the picture quality will look since I haven't seen one yet. In theory, 4k televisions have some 4x the resolution of 1080p. Some say that the naked eye really can't tell the difference though, unless you have a HUGE screen (like 100 inches) or if you're sitting inches from the screen. I think that there will probably be a noticeable difference between 4K and 1080p, but it will most likely be another 5-10 years before the price of these TVs are reasonable. Still, the Blu Ray Disc Association already announced that it has plans on updating the Blu Ray disc format to support 4k resolution. 4K is definitely coming, but I wouldn't worry about it too much yet.05. How difficult is setup? Will I need a professional to help me?Set-up is a breeze so long as you're just sitting the TV on a table or something. I was able to do it by myself. If you're mounting it on a wall, however, I would definitely recommend having someone help you who knows what they're doing. It doesn't have to be a "professional" exactly, but you don't want to mess up your wall by doing it wrong.06. I see I can plug my USB drive into this TV. That's cool. What all file formats can it play?So far I've found that it can only play music files such as mp3s and picture files such a jpegs. Kinda cool I guess, but actually disappointing for me. I would like to play video files or music in a lossless format. Fortunately most Blu Ray players now play a wider variety of file formats so you can still play digital media on your TV.07. How is the sound quality? Will I need to purchase surround sound speakers?Although I would never recommend an HD television without surround sound, I can actually say that I'm very impressed with the television speakers themselves. There is absolutely no distortion, even at high bass levels, and voices are crisp and clear.08. How is the glare?The screen is very reflective so you'll want to position it away from windows if possible. Windows on the side or behind the TV shouldn't create much of a problem, and artificial lighting hasn't caused any issues for me. It all depends on placement though, because the screen does have a mirror-like reflection to it.09. What's 600Hz mean? Will I be able to tell the difference between 60 Hz or 120Hz?In theory, 600Hz is the "refresh rate" or number of times a still image is refreshed in one second. So, 60Hz = 60 times per second and 600Hz = 600 times per second. A pretty extraordinary difference as far as numbers are concerned, but even the really picky tend to agree that it's hard to discern between 120Hz and 600Hz, except maybe when it comes to sports when you do tend to see some motion blur. CNET calls the Hz rate a "spec to ignore" because the typical eye can't tell the difference between 60 and 600. I agree that you shouldn't buy a TV solely on the refresh rate, but I believe you can tell a difference, especially between 60 VS 600. The image seems much smoother to me on this TV than those with lower Hz. Probably not a major difference, but the fact that this TV has the highest Hz rate in the market is just another reason to love it.10. I'm nervous about ordering expensive electronics online. What if it arrives damaged?I'm not sure if Amazon ships all televisions the same way, but I was able to set-up an appointment for delivery with the delivery company and they were very professional and courteous. Everything arrived in perfect shape. In my experience with Amazon customer service, you can always buy confidently from them because they're very helpful.11. Would YOU buy it?Good question. It should be noted that I received this system to test via the Amazon.com VINE program so I didn't actually have to pay for it. Now that I've experienced all the pleasure and wonder of its picture quality, would I actually pay $700ish for it? It's hard to say.I would be VERY tempted to go for an LED TV instead, because they are definitely the future format, but at the same time, I have absolutely no complaints about the picture quality of this Plasma screen - and it's very affordable. I'm also tempted by 3D TVs even though the 3D format doesn't excite me too much. There is definitely something cool about being able to watch a 3D movie right at home. Knowing me, I would most likely opt for the latest greatest (an LED 3D TV) but for the price, I can definitely back this TV up with a full-hearted recommendation. It doesn't have all the latest bells and whistles, but it is affordable and looks AMAZING. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: G. Young "Kindle"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a second TV for another room in our house. My main TV is a 58" Samsung Plasma That I purchased a few years ago for a lot more money than this one.One of the things I wanted in a new TV was Wi-Fi, but I didn't want to pay a lot of money. Fortunately, I got some advice from a local dealer who said to pick a cheaper TV that had good picture quality, then buy a Blu-ray player with Wi-Fi and save yourself a ton of money.I took his advice and found this TV. I have to say, after a few tweaks to the picture settings, this TV produces a very beautiful, crisp picture! I love it almost as much as my main TV and have spent quite a bit of time watching TV and movies on this over my other.The only minor problem I have with this TV is that it has a glossy finish and not a matted finish. This is something I missed while searching for a TV, so I'm not taking points off of the review. Sadly, it's in a very sunny room, with lots of windows, so during the day, there's quite a bit of glare and reflection from the windows. The black levels also wash out a bit on really bright days. Still, in the evening and at night, or if you are planning to place this in a dark room, this TV is awesome, especially for the price!One quick note is that it only has 2 HDMI slots, so if you have more than two HDMI devices to hook up to it, you might want to plan on getting a HDMI Switch Box. I planned ahead for this and just use one to switch between the Blu-ray player and the Xbox360 that's hooked up to it without any issues.I would definitely recommend this TV to others!!

Reviews.Title: For the price this is a very nice TV
Reviews.Author: G. Ware
Reviews.Content: This is my first plasma TV and so far I am satisfied.  Prior to this LG the only other flat screen TV's that I have had are LCD's by Sharp, Panasonic, and Samsung.  To start off the review I will focus a little on the delivery by Amazon.  The TV was delivered by Ceva and they did a good job.  I did not have them setup the TV, though that is part of their service.  The delivery company called to schedule the TV and gave me a four-hour window that they would deliver it within.  That is kind of a wide window but I got lucky and I must have been first on the list as Ceva actually showed up 20 mins before the delivery window started.  The delivery drivers brought the TV up to a spare bedroom on the 2nd floor, which was nice as the TV box is heavy.  For the 2nd part of the review I will focus in on the TV itself.  Unboxing and setup was straightforward.  It may take two people to lift the TV out of the box, depending on your lifting ability.  Setting the TV up on the stand was easy and requires 2 screws to secure it to the stand and it feels steady after it was setup.  I like the stand for the TV as it is sturdy and allows the TV to swivel.  The TV itself is very nice looking, I like the thin black frame of the TV.  The TV looks very good in a room on a TV stand.  The TV is very thin and could easily be hooked up to a wall mount.  The 50-inch is a good size for small to medium rooms.  Setup of the TV settings is easy and the user interface reminds me of my older Samsung.  There are easy option settings for picture, audio, channel, and input.  There are enough settings available to fine-tune the picture to your desire.  Out of the box the picture is not that great and will require time to experiment with settings to get it to the way you will like it.  The "eco" mode that is default picture settings is designed to save energy but it makes the picture too dark.  I set mine to standard picture setting and modified some of the settings to get the picture to a look that meets my needs.  Be patient with this process, for any TV, as it can take some time to find the right settings that work for you.  I'm still adjusting mine to bring the picture to my preferred look.  I am using this TV mostly for video gaming, Apple TV movies, and over the air digital TV.  I don't have my satellite hooked up to this TV.  The over the air digital TV looks good when on the HD channels, the non-HD channels look good enough.  At the higher resolution hdmi inputs like Xbox, PlayStation, and Apple TV, the TV picture is very good.  The picture is clear and colors are good (although black is sometimes a bit light for my tastes).  For a gaming TV this plasma works well.  The colors are rich and the speed of the TV makes the gaming smooth.  For the price of this TV and the size of the TV, it is a very good value.  LG has put together a very nice TV at a very attractive price point and that combination make it a very compelling option.  LCD's and LED's are much more expensive at this size screen.  This TV does not come with all the bells and whistles as more expensive TV's but for the price who needs all that extra stuff.Pros-1. Price- great price for this size TV from a well-known brand.2. Picture- very good for price.3. Size- good size for small and medium rooms.4. Look of TV- very attractive looking and will compliment or enhance any room.5. Sound- for a thin TV the sound is better than other brands I have had. The sound isn't stereo quality but for a thin TV the voice can be heard and that is a plus.  Other flat screen TV's I have had it is difficult to hear the person talk so I had to buy a sound bar.  For what I use this TV for I don't think a sound bar is needed.  If this is your main TV additional sound might be needed but for every day use it is adequate.Con-1. Only two hdmi inputs- for the price maybe it is ok but 2 hdmi inputs is not enough on a modern TV. Just hook up your cable and one game machine and you are out of hdmi ports.  If you have more than two hdmi connections you will have to purchase an hdmi switch/hub so that you can connect more than one. Keep this in mind as you evealuate this TV with other TV's as usually new TV's have at least 3 hdmi ports.2. Reflection- compared to LCD/LED TV's there is a fair amount of reflection on the TV.  If you have lamps or a lot of outdoor light coming in keep the reflection in mind.  I believe this is typical of plasma TV's so nothing specific to this TV.3. Black levels- compared to LCD/LED TV's the black level is sometimes a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: looked at buyers guides and plasma was the best option then this tv was the best
Reviews.Author: Inger Andersen
Reviews.Content: We have had this TV for two weeks and just love it...I had researched 'buying guides for TVs'...and with the way we live, a plasma TV was the best option...one of us sits side on, the other in front of TV...plasma you can see clearly from all angles - LCD/led only some models can you do this..also, we love watching sport and movies, and plasma is better at both of these, due to the plasma screen..there are always exceptions to this..but plasma came out the clear winner...our previous TV was a wide screen slim line CRT...so we were used to a glass screen..and at times of the day, there is a bit of reflection..but you soon get used to it..and its not a bother, esp when the TV is on...connecting TV is easy...and while its not a smart TV...there are many devices you can buy to make it smart if that's what you want..eg wifi blue ray player, wifi game machines etc...and the more 'stuff' you have on a device..the more can go wrong...simple is better...with the settings, we've experimented...and have found we have the picture on 'game' and the sound on 'sport'...usb connection, plays everything...when you choose usb...it brings up the options from the usb stick eg movies, music etc..you just click on what you want..and away it plays etc..easy..if you miss your favourite show..you can connect you laptop and then play the missed show on the TV..the size is perfect..and we couldn't be happier with it...best look around for specials etc which is how we bought ours...but,  the research I did..you cant choose a TV, by looking at the picture in the store..as, its set for 'store' and its bright etc..best do your research at home..and then maybe have a few models and go in store, to look at remotes etc...this plasma was on 'green save' and was very dull....not a good way to show the TV!! but, while this was on special, among other LCD/leds...it was obvious, they were pushing these TVs, though when asked, if this was a good TV...was told it was the best under $1,000..and you cant buy a similar sized LCD/led for this price...I would recommend, that you look at TV buying guides..and see what type of TV is best for your conditions...we are soo glad that we did...and  bought this TV..if you do...you wont be disappointed..

Reviews.Title: So far so good!!
Reviews.Author: Richard E Day
Reviews.Content: This item is replacing our 6 year old Phillips Ambiant Light 42" plasma that we thought had died. At first we were thinking there was a mistake in the size of the LG tv. It seemed smaller that the Phillips. It was an illusion of course. The case of the LG is much smaller than what we were used to. After mucking around with the different setting, we found that we really like the new picture. The definition of the picture is good. The ease of set up was really good. Any issues that I have found so far are all from my lack of looking harder at the specs and my lack of forward thinking. Amazon as always does what they say they will do. Shopping with Amazon is always a pleasure.Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Please do not buy from Adorama Camera
Reviews.Author: johncolucci
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after physically visiting a local store to see if I'd like this, and I did - I was impressed with the picture and felt the reviews on this item here on Amazon were a no-brainer. I ordered the TV without seeing Adorama was the seller, and assumed I was backed by the Amazon return policy.When the TV arrived, it was defective out of the box. The screen quality was poor and it flickered quite a bit. It was nothing like what I saw in the store. So, I began the process to return. I was shocked to learn that Adorama does not take TV's back above 47", which makes no sense. I emailed them about this, then called Amazon who then emailed them on my behalf to send return instructions, and Adorama replied to what was a few emails with the same response pretty much telling me I was screwed and to call LG. That's not the point. It's defective, and I've opted to purchase another TV by LG so I have a TV after waiting so long.Adorama doesn't seem to care, and after reading a plethora of consumer reviews on other sites, it looks like Adorama is a poor operation with terrible customer service. I have sent the TV back at Amazon's direction and have filed an A-Z claim. I am confident Adorama will continue to screw me, but am hopeful that Amazon will back me and help me get a refund.Word to the wise, be very careful you see who you're purchasing from.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about a month now, and I am very pleased for with this product. I had been searching for a new TV for about 4-5 months and was hesitant to get a plasma over an LED, but after reading numerous reviews, plasmas were the way to go, and I felt this was the best bang for the buck.The picture quality is excellent, the setup is easy, and I don't notice any lag when playing video games.  Blu Rays, and especially animated Blu Rays, look absolutely amazing.  The sound seemed pretty good when I tried it but almost immediately after hooking up the TV, I hooked up my surround sound system, so I don't have a great testimonial for the audio.It doesn't have all the bells and whistles (3D and Smart) but most people will already have a device that can stream Netflix, Hulu, etc., and I heard people who have 3D capabilities rarely use them.  If you don't have a streaming device, you can get a Roku player for pretty cheap.  I did want a 3D TV (I have one movie in 3D and a PS3) but there is no way of getting a 3D TV without smart capabilities, and it would have costed at least an extra $300.  This is why this TV was the best fit for me.  It was in my budget, and I felt I really didn't NEED the 3D.  I maybe for my next TV though.Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase.  I wasn't sure how big 50" would look in my living room but it looks huge (the distance from the couch to the TV is rather close though, about 8 ft).  I would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: stunning picture.
Reviews.Author: kb "airkelby"
Reviews.Content: beautiful tv.  lightweight and has a fabulous picture. even if it is a plasma we aren't worried that it will poop out in a few years, but then there will be new technology to replace it anyway.

Reviews.Title: Best Plasma Ever!
Reviews.Author: Joel Dales
Reviews.Content: Love it!!!!!!! Best priced tv for its quality. It's the best plasma i've ever owned! I highly recommend it to those who are searching for a tv in this price range.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gary M Zahn
Reviews.Content: i love every second i watch something on this tv! the shipping was great and it was packaged well and came in perfect condition and the picture is astounding!! the motion of whatever is being watched is smooth like real life and the picture is amazing i couldn't say anything other than WOW for about the first 45 min of the first bluray  i watched which was the avengers, i have no complaints about this tv and i do have to say that it does have a matte screen but trust me that is a good thing if you have any windows in the room it will be in, in short buy it its awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cheryl "addicted to audio books"
Reviews.Content: This is our first plasma TV. We have two other LG big screens in LCD so thought we'd try this. It has a beautiful crisp picture and good sound. It was also a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great picture onLG 50" Plasma
Reviews.Author: Kathie R. Cribbs
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. A few tweaks and the picture is great. Have had it a week and so far no issues.

Reviews.Title: Movie Enjoyment!
Reviews.Author: Jeff  K
Reviews.Content: Awesome no frills TV, I have a media PC so I have no need of "Smart" tv's and their extra cost.  Great picture, two hdmi inputs, but with a proper tuner/receiver you don't need much.  All I wanted was a very big computer monitor, and this is exactly that, great picture very warm not like an LCD where everything is so harsh, and fast motion is pixelated, this is more like a proper movie screen!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Nice guy
Reviews.Content: We've owned it for a month now. The picture quality and sound exceeds our expectations. Even previously watched movies on SD, look awesome

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Lien
Reviews.Content: this is a great TV. Very happy with it. In some of its reviews the reflection of the screen is mentioned, and it is indeed shiny, but since the TV stands in a darker corner in my house, this is not an issue. But if you plan to put it in a sunny room, you have to think about this. Great sound and easy plug in and ready. Great TV.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: G. Knowles
Reviews.Content: This is a good tv for the price.  I got it on Amazon Prime for $550.  I hesitate to give it five stars because I just like lcd tvs better.  I also have a Sony BRAVIA KDL-55EX501, and a Samsung LN40C630K, both lcd tvs, and I like them better.  Plasma tvs remind me of the old CRTs, it even has the glass screen that reflects everything (don't put it in a bright room, its great in the basement).  I have noticed that images will tend to burn in, like if you leave the xbox on single screen for a while or a dvd player.  But you can't even notice it really, and it completely goes away after a while.  I would say if money is no object, go with a Sony lcd.  But for the price, this tv is ridiculously awesome.  Another note about the TV, I wasn't sure if it would produce Dolby 5.1 from the digital optical out, but it does.  I have a Sony BDP-1100 plugged into this tv via hdmi, and use the digital optical out to go to an older Tecnics A/V receiver that does not have hdmi inputs.  It works great, produces true dolby prologic 5.1 and sounds awesome.  Darn good tv for the money.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: A. Dhir
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 50" plasma with a great picture, and zero smart features, no 3d, didn't really care about inputs. It was destined for my bedroom where it's sole input sources would be a cable box, and an AppleTV (which has all the "smart" features I need).The picture is noticeably good - though I can't say how it would fare if there were 20 other TVs next to it playing the same source - as you might see in Best Buy - there aren't.The only thing I don't like about it, and therefore the reason for the one star demerit, is that one of the two HDMI inputs is oriented sideways rather than towards the back, and that makes the cabling going in to the TV where it's hanging on my wall a little less neat - the one going in sideways sticks out to the left a bit. It's still "behind" the screen - it's tucked in a few inches - just facing wrong to keep cabling consistent. I could force it by kinking the cable down or something but haven't yet.Otherwise, I recommend this TV - great value.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my tv room and love the picture quality.  My kids like playing video games on it and watching their sports programs.

Reviews.Title: Value Priced Plasma
Reviews.Author: Allen Hurst
Reviews.Content: I own several HDTV's. All are plasmas, as this is the only current technology that gives you unlimited viewing angles and the best picture quality. When OLED becomes reasonable, this may change.I have a Samsung, a Pioneer Kuro and three Panasonics.This LG is the most reasonably priced big-screen (plus 50 inch) plasma you can buy.After tweaking the settings, the picture is good, but black levels are not on par with the Pioneer Kuro.I recommend this as a bedroom TV, not your main TV. (This is where I have it.)Sound from the speakers are good, however.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, it's priced a bit too high as of June 2013
Reviews.Author: Dave Stone
Reviews.Content: Update - I've used this tv for a week and upped it from 3 to 4 stars...great image quality for the money. None of the flashlight or clouding problems seen in some LCDs costing hundreds more (I played the Samsung lottery 2 years ago). Minor screen door effect on some inputs if viewed at < 10 feet from the screen. No buzzing or weird audio problems. Stock sound is also great, one of the better ones I've heard. Power consumption is less than my 42" LG LCD, and heat is not a concern, even after 10-12 hours of continuous use. I played Gears of War 3 online for almost 3 hours ("Horde"), and it looked like an image had set in. But after playing a looping full-screen movie for 12 hours after that, it was nothing to worry about.This 2013 50" model is similar to the 50PA5500 from last year, but with some notable options taken away. The PN6500 only has 2 HDMI ports, the 2012 model has 3...this one does NOT play movies via USB, the older model does - which is a nice feature to have without relying on a separate box/remote to hassle with. But the worst part is the menu. There was an option to see the firmware and hours on the older LG plasmas by using the red button to take you into the service menu (menu or home - red button). My 2011 LG 42" LCD had this, too. Maybe it's still there, but I could not find it. There's an anti-image burn setting, it's under Option - ISM Method, but no mention of it in the manual. The remote is fine, very small and not accurate - it's not the best but also far from the worst. The 2011 LG remote I had also worked on this one. What drove me crazy is that if I'm watching Netflix on Xbox, and switch to the tv, and switched back to Netflix, I'd get an 'Output protection error' and the app would crash. I think this might be due to the HDMI cable, but the other cable I used put artifacts all over the movie. Oh well. Just keep in mind you might want to upgrade HDMI cables or experiment with different ones.This is a great plasma, outside of the feature set and limited menu. Blacks look really black in the movies I watched. I played Arkham Asylum on Xbox for a bit and it looked great. The game had some flickering on loading screens which I've been told is normal for plasmas.  I also watched an NHL game, and it looked awesome. I'm about 100 hours into the initial burn-in but I'm debating returning it. The price  of this is currently a little too considering this is an entry-level model, although LG used to sell 720p sets a year or two ago in this model's  place. I'm probably going to replace it with a Sony KDL-50R550, which is more expensive, but I want the best 50" I can buy for under $1000. Or I might just keep both. This LG model is very similar to the TC-P50S60, but the Panasonic has a few more features and costs a little more.

Reviews.Title: Great television for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Kiki
Reviews.Content: I really love the beautiful picture on this plasma television (our other tv was LED). My husband had a pretty easy time unpacking and placing the tv on its stand (12 year old son helped!), the packaging was excellent. This tv also has great sound, we had external speakers set up for the tv this one is replacing, but we put them away for now, that's how good this tv sounds, which was a pleasant surprise.The set up is also easy, the remote makes it easy to navigate to the different set ups for picture and sound. We generally use the standard setting, there are several settings: standard, cinema, eco, game, photo, 2 "expert" settings (you can adjust these to your own specifications)and vivid. The picture wizard allows you to set the expert settings with ease and confidence, guiding you through with suggestions. Two settings will allow you to have a night and day setting, if needed. I watched the movie The Descendants on the cinema setting one evening, which is full of gorgeous scenery (Hawaii) and music, and really felt my "movie at home" experience was elevated from the usual.The extra HDMI outlet is easy to access. We plugged in our NeoTV streaming device to watch YouTube and Netflix, and switching back and forth between HDMI outlets is also fairly simple. This is a basic tv set, as far as extras go, (not a Smart tv) but still (in my opinion) more than adequate and easy to learn how to use pretty quickly.I think maybe my only complaint is about using the remote (manufacturer's or our in home tv remote). It just isn't as sensitive to the remotes/tvs we've had before. You really have to thoughtfully aim it at the tv's lower left hand corner for it to work, whereas, most tvs, even much older ones, we could aim the remote at the ceiling or the wall behind us and it would work. But that's pretty petty, considering what a great deal this tv is(and because most of the time, I'm changing the channel from the cable box, so it is mostly using tv volume and on/off when I am aiming at the tv). That all being said, the tv powers up instantly and turns off instantly as well, which I love.Such a great tv for a wonderful price! Really provides a fabulous tv watching experience.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Robert Heron
Reviews.Content: The item arrived in good order and as discribed.  Plugged it in and went through the setup with ease, couldn't have been easier.

Reviews.Title: BIG Purchase!
Reviews.Author: wslade
Reviews.Content: This was a big purchase both in physical size and cost! I was concerned about possible damage in shipping. It came packed in it's original box inside a larger box. The larger outside box was filled with packing material. There was no shipping damage!The Plasma screen has a beautiful picture. My wife and I enjoy watching sports and the new LG HDTV  has made watching our favorite sports even better!

Reviews.Title: Good so far
Reviews.Author: Bruce Harold
Reviews.Content: I have had no probems.  It has a good picture and the sound is good.  I have only had it a short time , maybe operqted it less than 10 hours.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: AJ Samuels
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful and elegant, this television is the best I've had so far. I wish It had 3 HD I ports though that's my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Met all criteria
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wagner
Reviews.Content: Great picture and decent on board audio. No problems with setup at all. I would wish for more inputs, but budget was a major issue and more inputs means higher price. Great tv for the money. After our Westinghouse died very young we would never be without the extended warranty, which was very affordable for a five yr plan through amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, low on features
Reviews.Author: Houndx
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is very good after adjusting some settings.  The sound is also very good compared to most other flat panel TV's.  The 2 things that disappointed me were the fact that it won't play any video source files and the only audio output it has is an optical audio out.  If you are wanting to hook up an external hard drive and play movies through the USB port then you are out of luck.  The TV only recognizes photo and music files.  You can hook your computer up using HDMI cables, but the picture can't be viewed in full screen, so you get a picture that is a fraction of the size of the TV.  For a budget TV the picture quality is worth it and I stream using a Roku so I can't complain.  As of this review date the TV an be purchased for $599 online with free shipping and no tax.

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to use in this case AWESOME !! It arrived early and once I turned it on and hooked up my x box one I completely understood why I shouldn't have been looking at anything else.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: adam alfeld
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with product.  The picture quality is excellent.  Set up was easy and the manual helps clarify the settings.

Reviews.Title: Like the movies
Reviews.Author: Craig Lancto
Reviews.Content: This TV is gorgeous. I love the clarity...but we are going through way too much popcorn (although the prices are much better than at the theaters).

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture
Reviews.Author: Chris Worcester
Reviews.Content: This television has an absolutely beautiful picture. All the HD levels look incredible.  It reflects light sources in a room which can be a little annoying but rarely a problem in my living room.  The remote is not very responsive but it could be the batteries I have been putting in it.  I really have enjoyed watching some of the latest move visual affects on it.

Reviews.Title: LG Electronics 50PN6500 50-Inch 1080p 600Hz Plasma HDTV
Reviews.Author: psychmom "Mom of Lego Master"
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price; works well; relatively easy to install.  Picture is clear; sound is excellent; packaging was excellent and easy to remove.

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: michito
Reviews.Content: I first turned this TV on 6 months ago.  It arrived as scheduled and sustained no damage.  There were no hassles in getting it going.  I was skeptical at start because I normally lean towards Samsung.  I replaced a 720p Plasma so this is definitely an improvement.  I would recommend this TV.  The one item I was a bit disappointed with was the sound but I fixed that with an optical cord going into a surround system.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Dave Snyder
Reviews.Content: Great tv for the price.  Perfect picture, good audio. The only con is the glare of the screen in bright light, typical of plasma TV's.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: Its a awesome TV. I was worried about plasma burn in...not a issue as long as you turn on the orbitor setting. Other than that...GREAT! AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: it is great!
Reviews.Author: cj stecklein
Reviews.Content: The TV is wonderful..full color of the football games is exactly what the doctor ordered! I would encourage everyone to purchase this TV and get the beautiful results I enjoy..

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Robert Almaraz "glanum on books"
Reviews.Content: On time. Quality picture is super. Size of screen is right for our living room. Delivery problem was solved immediately. Very satisfied overall.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Mark Klamik
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with this TV. The picture is very sharp and it's great for both watching movies or playing games. The only real downside to it so that the sound can be a little quite at times and the picture can be a little too dark. I found when playing games (Last of Us, Uncharted, etc) I would have to increase the brightness on both the TV and with in the game. I didn't really notice this problem when just watching TV. Overall, for the price that I paid, I am very happy with the TV.

Reviews.Title: My LG 50in
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This TV 1st came to my home via UPS and I found that it was broken.. Zmazon fixed that and resent one via FedEx. After getting it we had mounted it on the wall and tested it.. Picture is excellent, sound is great, functions are dynamic. Exploring the TVs capabilities is always great! It's performance without an hdmi cable alone is impeccable. I'm a happy LG owner thanks to amazons competitive price and free shipping!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture and surprisingly good sound from its speakers. Hard to beat a TV like this for its price. The layout of all the various connections in the back makes it easy to set up and have the TV running quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Rabman
Reviews.Content: Great! Tv looks great, easy to assemble. I recommend it, especially for the price. Picture quality is excellent and crisp

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: jsjj42000
Reviews.Content: Great TV, I now have 2 LG Plasmas and will continue buying LG until they give me a reason not to

Reviews.Title: Good price,
Reviews.Author: S. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I bought this 50" HDTV to have installed in my den so I could move a 42" Panasonic Viera Plasma HDTV which I moved to my bedroom. The price was definitely right for the LG and I have several LG appliances (refrigerator, gas stove, dishwasher, etc.) all of which I really like. While I'm not unhappy with this LG HDTV I don't think the picture is as good as the one on my older Panasonic. I was also surprised that the picture on the  50" LG doesn't seem significantly larger than the 42" Panasonic. Another disappointing aspect of this TV is that it only has two HDMI outlets! Overall, if I were to purchase again I'd buy a new larger Panasonic Viera Plasma HDTV: also Energy Star, has four HDMI outlets and just an overall better TV in my experience.

Reviews.Title: It arrived on time as allways
Reviews.Author: Jack Baumhardt
Reviews.Content: This is my first Plasma TV I really like the picture after some adjustment so far a good TV out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Kandice S. Arcaro "Kandy K."
Reviews.Content: Love this TV! Totally met all my familys expectations in every way! Picture is clear and vibrant, everything works easily and perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Not teccomended for altitudes over 2000 feet.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: What a great picture! I enjoyed it for the first week. After that it wouldn't turn on. The vendor Paul's TV was great and replaced it with minimal effort. The second one had the same great picture and lasted a week. I upgraded to a 55" LG LED Smart TV and have been happy  with that.If you are over 2000' in elevation I don't recommend a plasma TV.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: lovemyfamily
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV nerd.  I own a variety of flat-panel TV's in both plasma and LCD.  Honestly, they all look good to me.  This LG is no different.  I was looking for a 50" TV that was realtively slim at an affordable price.  This fits what I am looking for.  The TV is thinner than I expected (which is good...I thought for $599 I'd get an older, thicker version).  The standard picture setting is on 'Eco' mode so the picture looks a little dull until you adjust it (I put mine on 'sport' and the picture looks great).  Item shipped undamaged from Amazon so no issues there.  I was specifically trying to buy Samsung (which I own a 51" plasma of theirs) and would've bought another one but this one was $50 cheaper and, according to my research, is also made in S. Korea like Samsung (granted, not made in the USA...but I'll take a S. Korean made product over one made in China any day).  If you're looking for a 50" plasma I'd be shocked if you aren't happy with this one from LG.

Reviews.Title: Great after some tweaks!
Reviews.Author: Joe MacBu
Reviews.Content: I tested this TV after trying out LG's 60" version with SmartTV, so I was initially a little disappointed (This TV is about $900 cheaper). But after playing around with the advanced settings for video and sound quality, I'm pretty impressed by the quality for the price. I think adjusting the setting is absolutely necessary to get the most out of this unit. The video quality is rich, crisp, with great contrast and detail. The colors look accurate. Not to mention the great frame rate - very smooth even during fast action scenes. The sound quality is adequate (again after a bit of tweaking), but you'll probably want an external sound system if you're serious about sound quality.The setup is a breeze (but I only mounted it to the stand, not on a wall. I would advise having an extra set of hands to help with unboxing and moving the TV). And I find the remote for this TV to be much superior to the one for the 60" SmartTV. Obviously, it doesn't hook up to the internet like the SmartTV, but you can easily do that with a laptop or something like an AppleTv/Boxee/etc.

Reviews.Title: Clean clarity, bright at all angles, just like a window, ahhh
Reviews.Author: Olzab
Reviews.Content: Background: This is my fourth recent TV purchase, and the first that wasn't from Amazon. I returned to Amazon a Panasonic VIERA TC-L55ET5 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED/LCD for being a "dirty" looking window into my favorite golf shows and having horrible sound and other issues. I went back to the store to look again, then ordered and then returned a Panasonic VIERA TC-P50ST50 50-Inch 1080p 600Hz plasma for having a really loud buzz on all bright scenes, horrible sound and other issues. I then went back to the store to look again, then ordered and then returned a LG 47LA7400 47-Inch Cinema Screen because even though the one in the store looked just great, mine had the "dirty window" effect almost as bad as the first Panny, truly bad viewing angle, and (even though they turned out to be wrong as I discovered), LG support told me I had to use the Magic Remote to change inputs, necessitating carrying two remotes, because the "magic" remote was severely limited in its ability to control my other devices. I finally decided that I wasn't going to get any luck buying TVs from amazon and headed out to get one from the local store.OK, this finally brings me to the LG PN6500 I brought home. This TV has none of the bells the others had, no 3d, no smart, but it DOES have a great picture, easy to adjust, and great sound. There is no sign of any unevenness to the pixels or the glass, whatever made those lcd's look like they needed cleaning. Compared to the LA7400, the PN6500 is not a pretty unit, it's shiny-black everywhere, and the picture cheats - it doesn't even go out to the "thin-frame" bezel, adding a good half-inch to the apparent bezel width during the time (always) that the TV is on. The LA7400 looked SO much better in my room. But the PN6500 has a far superior picture and seemingly just as great sound, to my ears. And that's what really counts, to me. I wanted the bells and whistles too, but the local store didn't have LG plasmas that had them, so I've ordered - HDMI switch, 5 in, 1 out, with remote control, Built-in Equalizer, Blue Jeans Cable brand - to expand my HDMI inputs (luckily, I have a good learning universal remote) and G-Box Midnight MX2 Android 4.2 Jelly Bean Dual Core XBMC Streaming Mini HTPC TV Box Player to get the smartness, hopefully even better. The 3d I'll have to give up, for now - I'll wait for that til they get affordable TVs with the clarity of picture and sound I need that have it.My bottom line on the 50PN6500:Pros:Picture bright and clean to the corners - even in golf, and sky scenes, with no color bleedSounds greatCons:Slight buzz on DirecTV screensaver scenes - only place noticed yet -reason for 4 starPicture cheats inside bezel -reason for 4 starOnly 2 HDMI inputs - fix with HDMI switch and universal remoteNo smart capabilities - fix with tiny G-Box HTPC that plugs into HDMINo 3d - live without for now, as 98% of use would be 2d anywayUpdate: My first PN6500 from the local store died dead after 3 days - it would only flash red, then green then blue, etc., screens - the local store replaced it immediately, the latest one seems fine so far. Still recommended with fingers crossed based on all my recent experiences.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant stunning picture!
Reviews.Author: Wulfstan "wulfstan"
Reviews.Content: This plasma TV has a bright, brilliant, stunning picture, with great definition, and no blurring or pixelating. No "streaky action".Very easy to set up (except, see below) just "plug & play". But yes, those who like to monkey with stuff to get things "juuuust right" will find all the tools to do so. (Take a gander at fellow reviewer D.Debar's excellent review for his suggestions on what to do here).Sound is better than average, listen before buying that soundbar.Now for the bad things (both minor): altho easy to set up, this thing weighs a ton (actually 0.029 of a ton, aka 58#, but let's not quibble). It's also rather unwieldy until set up. So, altho you will not need your "tech guy" to set this up, there will need to be two of you. And, if you want it wall-mounted, consider bring in that handy-man.Next- glare. This is the trade off you get vs a LED (also LED's use less power)- you need to have this in a place where you can control the glare during TV watching hours.So, you get better picture than a LED TV of the same price.  Easy to set up. Easy to use. Price is good.OH, and they have to deliver this by a local freight co. Once I figured this out, it worked fine. But it's too heavy for USPS, UPS, etc.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, nice picture.
Reviews.Author: Values Privacy
Reviews.Content: This is my second plasma, I bought a panasonic (Panasonic VIERA TC-P50U50 50-Inch 1080p Full HD Plasma TV) about 1 year ago. So this review is a bit of a comparison.I immediately looked for the things that annoy me about the panasonic (image burn-in, buzzing, deep menus and response lag) and the LG was much much better.Pros:-Does not buzz (make noise). (well if I press my ear to it there is a slight buzz, in contrast, I can hear my panasonic buzz across the room though if its a bright screen).-The picture is excellent and I can turn off dynamic video settings. (this was impossible with panasonic and so it would change brightness depending of the content of the screen making it impossible to calibrate).-It gives me 2 "expert" presets that I can tweak, but the presets for cinema and game were excellent.-The quick menu is so nice. I can change screen presets or sounds without digging deep into menus.-The power LED, turn OFF when the TV is ON. This is so nice: no distractions when watching TV.-Sound: The speakers are not bad. What really shines is the option to make dialog clearer than the background noise. This is adjustable and works well. This is very handy if you don't want to turn the volume too high at night or something and still want to hear the dialog.Cons:-I have to aim the remote pretty accurately. I hate that so much. It's 2013, why to companies make remotes so cheap and frustrate people for years?...-While there is no burn-in issues, the manual doesn't talk about it except to mention to play a screen saver. There is no anti-image-retention screen (I haven't needed it so it may be a moot point).This is not a con but leaves a bitter taste of bad advertising/claims: The box says TruSlim Frame. Yes the frame is thin but there is a wider bezel still (the picture never reaches the frame, there is a hidden black bezel under the glass).Conclusion:With my limited exposure to plasma TVs, I will pick LG over any Panasonic every time. There has been no image retention (burn in), and it looks amazing.Note on buying from Amazon: Save ALL the packing material in case you have to return it. The carrier didn't check if the TV even turned on for me since it was colder than 50 degrees F outside. Amazon advertizes that they can dispose of the packaging for you (in which case you can't return the TV if it doesn't work, but carriers hate that I think so they will try not to take care of the packaging for you).

Reviews.Title: nice tv  if the stands  were worth a  crap
Reviews.Author: Markus Wolfe "markus"
Reviews.Content: nice  tv  except  my  tv  fell  off  my stand  when  no one  was  around,,further  lookin  that a  clip  had  broke on the  stand  so  i expect a  new  one

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Towani "Chris"
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I love this TV.  I had a 42 inch plasma before, and wanted another because of the awkward viewing area and the way our room is set up.I did give the TV - 1 star though for a reason.  Fed Ex.  Honestly, if I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't order online.  The day Fed Ex delivered it, I was in my basement and my wife opened the door for him.  I heard a loud crash up stairs and ran up because I thought someone was hurt.  My wife looked at me and said she told him it was a TV, but he just threw it down anyways and walked off.  Seriously - I really didn't think the TV was going to work.  However, it did.  Hopefully for years to come :)  But for $579 with free shipping, I couldn't resist.  But if I saw it at a store for close to that price, I'd just have soon as gone and picked it up myself so I didn't risk it being thrown around like that again.I know that doesn't reflect the TV, but I think it's important to know.  The TV shipped from CA to NC, so food for thought.

Reviews.Title: Great plasma TV
Reviews.Author: LG
Reviews.Content: This will be one of the last waves of plasma TVs. It's a pity they are phasing them out. The 600Hz refresh and the warm colours are a pleasure to look at. I recommend getting this TV if you want to get your plasma before they are gone.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Scott Sherwood
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price, arrived before shipping deadline, and with no problems.  will post more on the TV after i have the TV for a while

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Ddalrymple
Reviews.Content: This TV is great. For the price I don't think you can get better.I like that its not a smart tv. Less to go wrong with it if you ask me.Besides we already have an xbox 360 and a roku so the smart tv wasn't really needed.Excellent picture. Good sound without any extra speakers.I still got a sound bar with a sub, but the sound quality without it is very good.No problems at all so far.Very Happy.

Reviews.Title: Can't complain for the price
Reviews.Author: TeamLP
Reviews.Content: Free shipping, no tax, and a great price! I mean you can't beat that. Yes, it only has two HDMIs, but thats all I need in the living room. This isn't my movie room TV, but I wouldn't mind getting another one for my security cameras (we'll see)... Overall, the picture is nice, the sound is way better then I thought, and its really light. Sure glad I got it when I did.

Reviews.Title: BEST brand made for the MONEY !!!
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I now own 3 LG TV's ( 42 led,50 plasma & 60 3D )plus BluRay players, I looked over 2 years in all the stores & a salesman highly recommended LG ...I was still skeptical ( it's hard to make a really good decision in the stores ) luckily for me a friend of a friend has a LG plasma, I've seen most other brands at friends...but the LG is the BEST by far ...  PLEASE give any and all LG products a try & you won't be sorry...Most if not all parts are made in the U S A then assembled in Mexico ...  Thanks for your time, Lawrence,  Michigan

Reviews.Title: Sharp picture, great contrast
Reviews.Author: Benjamin L Whitener
Reviews.Content: It's a no-frills TV in terms of "smart" features, and that's exactly what I wanted. The contrast (coming from an older LCD) is far, far better. If you're smart and don't care if a TV is thin or light and doesn't have netflix built in, it's hard to beat this TV for the price. Loads of customization controls for the picture, as well.You do have to control the ambient light in your room to eliminate the glare, which is a problem with any TV, but more so with a plasma than it is an LCD. Some inexpensive blackout curtains (also from amazon) take care of it pretty well.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves this TV.
Reviews.Author: Nauman Sheikh "Lets talk Turkey"
Reviews.Content: LG has made a nice slick looking tv. My mom loves it. The photo is nice and clear and the sound is good too. I can say the sound is better than the panasonic plasma that i have at my house. Not a bad buy. The shipping was fast and very stealthy. The shipper delivered it to my neighbor since my mom was not home. (that Ok.).Thanks LG.

Reviews.Title: great product for the price
Reviews.Author: stealingapples
Reviews.Content: This product is better than its price. My only gripe would be the sound quality.  But then I remember the price. Other than that this TV is a great bargain for such a good picture and ease of setup.

Reviews.Title: Great price and quality.
Reviews.Author: Joshua Adam Jones
Reviews.Content: If you have had a high-end plasma television, then you will notice a difference in the picture quality from that to this.  Nonetheless, the picture is still very good and when considering the price it becomes excellent.  It has a number of setting options to optimize the picture quality to fit your desires.  The speakers on the LG put out ample, clear sound.  It has two HDMI ports, which is sufficient for my needs, though I wish it had another.  Installation of the TV stand was simple and quick.If you're looking for a TV at a relatively cheap price that provides an above average picture on a large scale, then this is the TV for you.  If not, then why are you here reading this?

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Mikey "Mike"
Reviews.Content: We're latecomers to the HDTV world, but we are absolutely astounded by the quality of this set.  This is a simple TV, no smart TV, apps, 3D, etc., but GREAT picture quality.  Will probably connect a HTPC later.  You can use many other devices for streaming video.  Anyway this is a simple, inexpensive way to connect to HD cable.  Paired with mid priced speakers and amp for a little over $1,000 total.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Misfit
Reviews.Content: Being the book-worm that I am, I don't watch much television and have put off replacing my 1980s dinosaur, so my experience with this television is likely different than other reviewers might have. I don't hang out at sports bars or with friends who do nothing but sit and watch their big screens all day. I don't play games either, so this television is a whole new world to me, and I'm still trying to figure out what-all I can do with it - there are a whole lot of bells and whistles I may never use (advice appreciated - I'm a babe in the woods here).Set up was fairly easy, but since the television is so HUGE and heavy, it's definitely a two-person job, even though attaching the base to the monitor is a matter of a few screws here and there. At this time I don't have a bunch of equipment (i.e. DVD) to hook up to the television, but I did like the plus of a cord tie at the back to keep them all tidy. Once hooked up to the cable, there's some set up to go through with the remote (language, etc.). It looks like there's a bunch of options for adjusting the picture quality, but after choosing the home viewing option, I can't imagine wanting to adjust anything. The color and image quality are perfect, I had no idea Guy Fieri's Camaro was that red and shiny. Wowza, what a difference from the old set.Back to set up, with the cable I have, there's a digital converter box that's required, along with the cable company's remote for channel switching, so that gorgeous remote with way more buttons than I have any idea what they are for is probably going to gather dust somewhere. The most complicated part of getting up and running was figuring out the cable connections and how to get the channels from the converter box onto the TV (I really can't remember what finally worked), but after that I was up and running - but so far I've mainly watched the Food Channel and CNN. A bit miffed that now I really would love to watch some TNT and AMC and their idea of *classics* is Dirty Harry? I'll keep looking for real classic movies.The sound is very good as well, but until I get a set of cordless headphones, I haven't given it a full test (condo and elderly neighbors making blasting music a bad idea). If I can get my spare room wired for cable, I hope to move the TV in there and also try it out by hooking up the computer. If so, I'll pop back to edit this review with my thoughts.Even though this is probably more television than I'll ever need, it is a beauty and I already love it, and a HUGE thank you to the folks at LG and Amazon Vine for giving me a new life in the digital age. And can I say that all the lads at the office were drooling over this for two days before I could get it out of there and on its way home?

Reviews.Title: Great until power board went out.
Reviews.Author: Adolay
Reviews.Content: Purchased tv for basement sportsroom with limited light.  Performed wonderfully until 14 mos old.  Power unit went out and 350.00 parts and labor to fix.  I googled this problem on the net and it is all over the place for this tv.  TV viewing for this unit in my household was minimal...football season weekends only for one year.  Will not buy lg again.

Reviews.Title: LG plasma
Reviews.Author: Lysa
Reviews.Content: Wow! Fabulous PRICE, Great picture and sound. Having it hooked up to a HarmonKardon system for an even better movie watching experience! After purchasing this to replace my SAMSUNG 50" Plasma due the the screen going black while sound still coming thru, found out that there's a class action suit regarding capacitors & reviewed list to find that my model was listed!!! Called, they sent out a repair man who replaced the whole power supply board ((in 15 mins)) So now I have 2 50" plasmaTV's

Reviews.Title: GOOD TV
Reviews.Author: Geomey
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a very good TV. Clear picture, good sound, and easy to set up. Colors are deep and accurate. Do not like reflections of the glossy screen.

Reviews.Title: 2 busted tvs
Reviews.Author: Frankie
Reviews.Content: One star because really never recieved a working tv. Recieved two with busted screens. Then when I gave up on the idea of getting this tv took over two weeks to get a refund.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: This plasma has a very nice picture. I am disappointed on two fronts.1. The dynamic range is not as broad as I had hoped. This disappointment is probably my high expectations rather than the deficiency of LG. I had read several articles prior to purchasing and I had hoped that plasma would provide deeper blacks.2. The protective glass on the front is very reflective. I have the TV in my living room and I need to make sure the shades are pulled in order to see the image during the day. The reflective glare of the windows (or even lights in the room during the night) is more than noticeable. A little AR coating on the screen would've been helpful, but I suppose the might have pulled the price up higher than I wanted to pay.--Dave

Reviews.Title: Automatic Brightness Control (ABL) completely ruins this set
Reviews.Author: Mike Hawk
Reviews.Content: I've wanted a plasma since 2009 but never wanted to pay the entry price.  Got in on a smoking 2012 Panasonic UT50 deal at the beginning of the year but the Pilot freight monkeys that Amazon used delivered a box full of broken glass.  So I waited some more.  Finally I see that this set is getting great reviews as a no frills plasma.  Price is right so I pull the trigger.  My first reaction was OMG this is an amazing set.  But after the newness wore off I quickly discovered just how DIM this set is.  No amount of tweaking could change it.  Then to make maters worse I discovered this 3 letter devil on an acronym... ABL.  For those that don't know, if the picture gets to a certain brightness level (say a sunny scene, or a commercial with an all white background) this set will automagically kill the brightness.  It's a TOTAL buzz kill.  So now you have dirty whites AND dim scenes.  I thought I could live with this since I do most of my TV viewing at night.  Nope.  It is just way to dim.  Promptly packed it back up and sent it on its way to Amazon.  Who knows, maybe I got a dud.  I really had high expectations for the inky blacks and blur free images that plasmas produce.  I think I'll just settle for higher caliber LCD instead.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: gerald bramble
Reviews.Content: The screen reflect too much light and is poor compared to my previous Panasonic. Price was hot but picture during the day reflects too much light and we have to draw the shades. Never did it beforeRemotes are not as user friendly either

Reviews.Title: I thought the images would be clearer.
Reviews.Author: Bowman
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this is a big-screen HD monster and was very affordable, but it's my first HD TV and I thought the images would be crisper.  Maybe I just need to get a Blu-Ray player to take it to the next level.Also only has one set of input jacks for standard cables, so my low-fi DVD player is plugged into that.  I used an HDMI cable to plug in my XBox 360 on the side of the TV, and that seems to be working fine.Remote is pretty standard nothing revolutionary, although you do have to point it RIGHT AT the lower left corner of the TV to get it to work if you're sitting too close (which I probably am).

Reviews.Title: Blurred screen
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: While watching baseball on this TV the screen images are distorted sometimes where the image stops then starts again.  Some times this is quite annoying

Reviews.Title: TV won't start
Reviews.Author: M. Schindhelm
Reviews.Content: We recieved this product, assembled the stand then plugged it in. The tv's backlight turns on and it makes a noise when we plug it in, but the tv will not power on. We tried the power button on the remote and on the tv itself. We also tried replacing the batteries on the remote and changing where the tv was plugged into.

Reviews.Title: Dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: Brandon Mayes
Reviews.Content: I've heard nothing but good reviews about this television so that was the reason why i purchased it.And the reason i am giving it two stars is because it was broken when it arrived.When it got to my house i took it out of the box and the screen had several cracks running through it.Hopefully I can exchange it for another one so I can give it a good review.
